teaser: The trio has focused on the behavior of the stock market as well as the efficiency of markets.
title: Nobel Prize in economics goes to three Americans
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, October 14, 2013
contenttemplated:
[{"content":"

The Nobel Committee has awarded the Nobel Prize in economics to three Americans: Eugene Fama, Lars Peter Hansen, and Robert Shiller. The trio has focused on the behavior of the stock market as well as the efficiency of markets. Marketplace’s Nancy Marshall Genzer joins David Brancaccio to discuss the economists and their work. 

","type":"text/html"}]
description: The trio has focused on the behavior of the stock market as well as the efficiency of markets.
contentencoded: The Nobel Committee has awarded the Nobel Prize in economics to three Americans: Eugene Fama, Lars Peter Hansen, and Robert Shiller. The trio has focused on the behavior of the stock market as well as the efficiency of markets. Marketplace’s Nancy Marshall Genzer joins David Brancaccio to discuss the economists and their work.
